content: Research institute in Singapore **Asian Institute of Digital Finance** (**AIDF**) is a research institute to enhance education, research and entrepreneurship in digital finance. ## History AIDF is a collaboration between the [Monetary Authority of Singapore](/wiki/Monetary_Authority_of_Singapore), the National Research Foundation and the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) (NUS) and was established in 2021. ## Initiatives ### Applied Research The institute also concentrates on applied research in [green finance](/wiki/Green_finance) and deep [credit analysis](/wiki/Credit_analysis) to facilitate digital infrastructure for [B2B](/wiki/Business-to-business) digital finance development in Singapore. ### Business Incubation The institute also facilitates [business incubation](/wiki/Business_incubation) to acquire innovative fintech ideas from research and classroom studies for a wider business world. - www.aidf.nus.edu.sg - Speech at the launch of Asian Institute of Digital Finance by [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat), Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore This article about an organization in Asia is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Asian Institute of Digital Finance
